com.travelbank.knit.schedulers.heavy

Class HeavyTaskScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.travelbank.knit.schedulers.heavy.HeavyTaskScheduler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SchedulerInterface

    public class HeavyTaskScheduler
extends java.lang.Object
implements SchedulerInterface
    This is a SchedulerInterface that is meant to handle heavy weight tasks such as downloading large files/images. Tasks will be run on an Android IntentService. Knit creates a pool (PriorityQueue) of 4 HeavyThread s which are IntentServices. The pool prioritizes these bases on the number of current running tasks. The next task will always run on the HeavyThread with the least number of tasks running.
    See Also:
    HeavyThread, HThread1, HThread2, HThread3, HThread4

      • queueLock

        private static final java.lang.Object queueLock

      • avaiableThreads

        private static final java.util.PriorityQueue<HeavyTaskScheduler.AvailableThread> avaiableThreads
        PriorityQueue for all HeavyTaskScheduler.AvailableThreads. Priority is determined by the number of active running tasks. PriorityQueue.poll() will always return the thread with the lowers number of active running tasks.

      • target

        private SchedulerInterface target
        SchedulerInterface that will be running the consume task when the task here is complete.

      • getLeastBusyThread

        private HeavyTaskScheduler.AvailableThread getLeastBusyThread()
        Returns the least busy thread. It is determined by the PriorityQueue that compares their total number of active running tasks.
        Returns:
        the least busy thread that is wrapper in a HeavyTaskScheduler.AvailableThread.
